Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: 16384 nodes is 16384 komodod binaries. You need at least 2 one to send transactions and one to mine, although in the real world it would require more, come to think of it, for the notarizations it needs at least 3 nodes per chain, but it depends how you want to define it, as I am doing 64 chains (64 komodod binaries) on a single notary server, so is a server a node or the software a node?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think for technical reasons each chain having 3 nodes minimum to work would be the best way to describe it.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: That allows all chains in the cluster to talk to each other as a single chain.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [matrix] <n2okpride:matrix.org> I think we need to do a very indepth competitive analysis against the other projects in the scaling race, and their scaling methods. I'd like to be able to make an accurate like-for-like comparison, and avoid having holes be poked in our stories at a technical level.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: In several cases, name change for sake of name change has hurt things significantly

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: everything is on the table, but it needs to meet some sanity test requirements and any change of "komodo" name itself brings the risk of this, so by default all rebrands that retain "komodo" have less risk.

Author: dan.#2473
Content: if its considered there should likely be tons of stats/unbiased surveys to back up data. it's less about the name, but more about what people currently think when they think komodo. If achieving the goal is more likely/easier with a new name, that might be a better choice than trying to rebrand with the komodo name. Personally I don't really care one way or the other, but every single person in this discord is likely bias and likes the name komodo, as we all made our way here so something about it compelled us

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: since most everybody says the problem with komodo marketing is that nobody has heard of it, there seems to be not much gained by changing the name itself

Author: dan.#2473
Content: could be correct, I think it would be worth it for the agency to get some data to back that up
